subject: Belmont Stakes
Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Chief’s Lake claimed a three-and-a-quarter-length victory yesterday in the $107,700 Mike Lee Stakes at Belmont Park, the first leg of the Big Apple Triple for 3-year-olds bred in New York. The series continues with the New York Derby at Finger Lakes on July 14 and concludes with the Albany Stakes at Saratoga on Aug. 22. Chief’s Lake can earn a $250,000 bonus for a sweep of all three. Chief’s Lake, trained by Steve Asmussen and ridden by Garrett Gomez, paid $8.90 for a $2 bet to win.
